website_summaries.verdict: Reasonably priced kneeboard that works great as a starter board for kids.
pros: Padding on the base and strap makes a more comfortable ride
Hook on the front allows you to tow the kneeboard
Size and design mean this is a kneeboard made for kids
Includes handles on the sides to help beginners maintain balance
cons: Designed for riders up to 120 pounds so not made for most adults

customer_reviews.title: Seems great to me
customer_reviews.text: Seems great to me, but the kids ( who are the ones who need to use it) claim it is too small. So we have been using a larger model I bought used. I am keeping it because I think in time after they get more proficient, they will like it. Seems well made and should work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner 8 year old.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 8 year old Grandson. He has never knee boarded before and he learned very easily on his board. 100% satisfied with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Took on water
customer_reviews.text: Started taking on water (and no way to drain it) the first time we used it. Wish I had sent it back but I procrastinated and missed the deadline.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: This has been great for my kids (7 to 11)
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my kids (7 to 11). The handle holder is very handy for beginners. Strap is not long enough for a large adult but I doubt that will surprise many.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson's

customer_reviews.title: Apparently this is for watersports...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale and in the display at a store for ski equipment and snowboards... Apparently I'm just finding out now that this thing is actually meant for water sports. I have no idea how it works for that but it is extremely versatile as a snow body board since you can kneel on it, sit on it, or lie belly down on it. The trick is that you do have to find an extremely slick hill because it will not transfer enough body heat like a cheap plastic sled to melt a small film to create a slippery slop on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
